Definition: Made smaller or less; reduced in size, amount, importance.
Breathing that is difficult and requires a lot of effort.
To continue to exist or stay in the same place or condition.
Something handed down from an ancestor or from the past; money or property left to someone in a will.
Lack of variety and interest; tedious repetition and routine.
The quality or state of being prepared to do something; readiness.
The process of earning revenue from an asset, business, or service.
To fail to care for or give attention to someone or something.
Turkish Translation: İhmal etmek, göz ardı etmek, bakmamak.
Verb Form): V1: neglect, V2: neglected, V3: neglected

Definition: A heap or stack of objects; to lay or place in a pile.
To accumulate or become gathered into a pile or heap.
The part of a garment that covers the arm.
To prepare to work hard, usually by literally rolling up long sleeves.
Having or showing keen interest, intense desire, or impatient expectancy.
Verb Form): V1: eager, V2: eagerned, V3: eagerned

Definition: The quality of a sound governed by the rate of vibrations; to throw or hurl.
Verb Form): V1: pitch, V2: pitched, V3: pitched

Definition: Very enthusiastic and keen to present or propose an idea.
Having or showing a confident and forceful personality.
The action of pausing or delaying due to uncertainty, fear, or reluctance.
To place something on a surface; to suppress or quell; to criticize; to euthanize.
Verb Form): V1: put, V2: put, V3: put
